definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Such were the literature and art of the ruling class in China's feudal era.
sentences.chinese: 中國封建時代統治階級的文學藝術，就是這種東西。

sentences.english: Zhougong's lording or not is an important political issue in feudal society of China.
sentences.chinese: 周公是否稱王，在封建時代曾是一個重大的政治問題。

sentences.english: The royal painting institute of China during her feudalistic ages was a formal painting organization for the royal court.
sentences.chinese: 中國封建時代的畫院是一種的宮廷繪畫藝術機構。

sentences.english: This was the idealistic choice of life for the outstanding intellectuals in feudal age.
sentences.chinese: 這是封建時代傑出知識分子一種理想化的人生選擇。

sentences.english: I wont bleed myself dry in this new feudal age.
sentences.chinese: 我不會流血自己幹，在這個新的封建時代。

sentences.english: In feudal times, the inappropriate decisions of the successor to the throne often lead to civil strife in the court.
sentences.chinese: 封建時代皇家立嗣處理不好往往會引發宮廷內亂。

sentences.english: He is a typical loyalist patriot of feudal times.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個典型的封建時代的忠君愛國人物。

sentences.english: So" on door read banned" became a feudal era.
sentences.chinese: 所以“雪夜閉門讀禁書”成爲封建時代一大樂事。

sentences.english: During feudal times, it was a custom to put up prayers for rain during droughts .
sentences.chinese: 在封建時代，有在旱災時求雨的風俗。

definition: offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)

pinyin: li4 shi3 wei2 wu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
lit. to build a cart behind closed doors/to be overly subjective and disregard the outside world (idiom)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
